title: Which format/tool to store 'basic' informations?
content:
It's really a productivity bottleneck when various analysis tools can't share information.

What's an efficient way to store symbols+comments+structures, so that they can be easily imported into other reversing tools?

I used to rely on SoftIce's IceDump extension to load/save IDA symbols, or load exported MAP symbols from IDA into OllyDbg via gofather+'s GoDup, but nothing recent nor portable.

comments.text: I didn't downvote, but your question is not really clear.
I rewrote it, with a real question this time.

answers_data.content:
A potential tool would be QuarkLabs' qb-sync, which advertises:

  • Synchronization between IDA and WinDbg, OllyDbg2, GDB
  • Source code available (GNU GPL 3)

comments.text: Link only answers are not considered answers. You should add a short description. meta.reverseengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/64/â€¦
ok, I added a short description based on their doc.
Would it be possible to expand this a little bit more? I've made some edits, you should be able to see where you can add other potentially good features.
